trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Tsabli is perplexed by a coffee conundrum.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TODO_00<tab>Throw the smoke bomb repellent at the cautious mountain bear.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TODO_01<tab>Inspect the brown mounds of dirt.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TODO_02<tab>Deliver the soiled coffee beans to Tsabli.

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_000<tab>You there. Might I beg your assistance with something? I was taking a stroll through the valley the other day, when I discovered coffee beans scattered in the brush with not a coffee plant in sight.

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_001<tab>Curiosity got the better of me, and so I brought some back here to brew. The taste was simply <var 1A 02 /var>exquisite<var 1A 01 /var>. I'd like to acquire more, but therein lies the problem.

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_002<tab>I found the beans in Chabameki─an area south of here known to be the territory of mountain bears. They'd tear me to shreds, but something tells me you could manage the trip. Here─take these smoke bombs to drive back the bears, and bring back whatever coffee beans you can.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_006<tab>Have no fear, my friend! With that smoke bomb repellent, you'll be safe as can be! Probably, anyway...
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_010<tab>Uwaaah!
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_011<tab>What was that for!? I told you to use the repellent on the mountain bears, not <var 1A 02 /var>me<var 1A 01 /var>!
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_BEAR05037_000_012<tab>Grrr...
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_SYSTEM_000_013<tab>The mountain bear gazes at you warily, with no hint of moving an ilm. Use the smoke bomb repellent to drive it away.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_SYSTEM_000_015<tab>Your hands navigate through the sticky soil, finally grasping something solid within─a clump of coffee beans.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_SYSTEM_000_016<tab>The soil is warm to the touch, and surprisingly moist. Nevertheless, you plunge your hands inside, and retrieve a dripping clump of coffee beans.

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_SYSTEM_000_017<tab>The stench emanating from this mound of soil is a veritable assault on the nostrils. But you persevere in the name of delicious coffee, and stick your hands inside to claim one last clump of coffee beans.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_020<tab>Wonderful, you're returned! I'm glad to see you still have all your appendages! Ah, but tell me, were you able to find more of those wondrous coffee beans?
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_021<tab>Marvelous, thank you! Ah, but they seem to be covered in...is that soil?
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_022<tab>Hmm. Well, this appears to be dung. That would explain... <gasp> Aha!

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_023<tab>As omnivores, mountain bears feed upon flora and fauna alike. Unbeknownst to us, however, it seems they've developed a liking for our coffee plants, and have been snacking on them in secret.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_024<tab>But because the beans are difficult to digest, they remain whole in the bears' leavings.

TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_025<tab>I suspect that while inside their stomachs, the flavors and fragrance of the plants and fruits the bears normally eat permeate the beans, diminishing their bitterness and resulting in coffee beans with a fruity, sweet flavor.
TEXT_KINGZB008_05037_TSABLI_000_026<tab>A most intriguing discovery─one I couldn't have made without your help. Thank you! I daresay we have a new premium blend of coffee on our hands!
